channel.title: Workflow on SourceMation
channel.description: Recent content in Workflow on SourceMation

item.title: Mosquitto
item.description:
Description

Eclipse Mosquitto is a widely-adopted open-source MQTT broker that serves as the backbone for countless IoT deployments worldwide. Developed under the Eclipse Foundation, it implements the MQTT protocol versions 5.0, 3.1.1, and 3.1, making it compatible with virtually any MQTT client application.

The broker is renowned for its lightweight architecture and exceptional performance, capable of handling thousands of concurrent connections while maintaining minimal memory usage. Mosquitto supports advanced features including message persistence, SSL/TLS encryption, bridge connections, and flexible authentication mechanisms.

item.title: JRE-21
item.description: JRE 21 is the Java Runtime Environment derived from the JDK 21 Long-Term Support (LTS) release, and it’s intended for end-users or servers that only need to run pre-compiled Java applications. It contains the core components, primarily the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) and core class libraries, but omits development tools like the compiler (javac). Any application running on JRE 21 gains the benefits of the JDK 21 platform, including the performance improvements from the finalization of Virtual Threads and other new language features.

item.title: Maven
item.description: Apache Maven is a foundational software project management and build automation tool. Using a central XML configuration file (the pom.xml), Maven manages all project dependencies (downloading required libraries from repositories) and executes a standardized build lifecycle (e.g., compile, test, package, install, deploy). This convention-over-configuration approach simplifies the build process, making it reproducible and standard across all Java-based projects.

item.title: Manageiq
item.description: ManageIQ is an open-source cloud management platform (CMP) that provides a single interface for managing hybrid IT environments. It discovers and monitors resources across disparate virtualization (like VMware), private cloud (like OpenStack), and public cloud (like AWS, Azure) platforms, as well as container platforms like Kubernetes. Its key features include “Insight” (discovery, monitoring, analytics), “Control” (security, compliance, policy enforcement), and “Automate” (provisioning workflows, orchestration). It essentially acts as a “manager of managers,” giving administrators a single pane of glass for governance and automation.

item.title: Kubectl
item.description: kubectl is the primary command-line interface (CLI) used to communicate with and manage a Kubernetes cluster. It communicates with the Kubernetes API server to execute commands. Administrators and developers use this utility for nearly all cluster operations, including deploying applications (using .yaml manifests), checking the status and logs of running pods (observability), managing node health, and configuring all Kubernetes resources like services, deployments, and secrets.

item.title: CloudNativePG-16
item.description: CloudNativePG (CNPG) is a Kubernetes operator designed by PostgreSQL experts to manage PostgreSQL database workloads natively on Kubernetes. It covers the entire operational lifecycle, automatically managing database deployment, high-availability configurations (primary/standby replication), rolling updates, backups, and failover procedures. It integrates directly with the Kubernetes API, automating the complex tasks that a human database administrator would normally perform.

item.title: CloudNativePG-17
item.description: CloudNativePG (CNPG) is a Kubernetes operator designed by PostgreSQL experts to manage PostgreSQL database workloads natively on Kubernetes. It covers the entire operational lifecycle, automatically managing database deployment, high-availability configurations (primary/standby replication), rolling updates, backups, and failover procedures. It integrates directly with the Kubernetes API, automating the complex tasks that a human database administrator would normally perform.

item.title: EZD-RP
item.description: Complete and ready-to-deploy set of software and tools, compatible with the EZD RP application, necessary for its installation in your own infrastructure, along with ongoing updates.

item.title: ArgoCD
item.description: ArgoCD is a declarative, version-controlled application deployment tool designed to automate and manage application configurations and environments. It follows the GitOps pattern, utilizing Git repositories as the source of truth for defining the desired application state. Users can specify Kubernetes manifests using various methods such as kustomize applications, Helm charts, JSONnet files, or plain directories of YAML/json manifests. ArgoCD automates the deployment process based on the desired application state defined in Git repositories, making application deployment and lifecycle management easy, auditable, and understandable.

item.title: Greenplum DB
item.description: Greenplum Database (GPDB) is an open-source database optimized for data analytics in distributed environments, utilizing a massively parallel processing (MPP) architecture. It enables the simultaneous processing of large datasets across multiple nodes, providing high performance and scalability, and supports advanced business analytics and big data processing.

item.title: GP Backup
item.description: GPBackup is an efficient tool for managing backups in Greenplum Database. It allows the creation of full and incremental backups of entire databases as well as selected tables. With advanced data compression and segmentation, it ensures fast backup creation and the ability to restore data to any point in time.

item.title: Sealed Secrets
item.description: Sealed Secret is a tool used in the Kubernetes ecosystem for securely storing sensitive data, such as passwords or private keys.

item.title: GP Upgrade
item.description: GPUpgrade is an automation tool for upgrading Greenplum Database, providing a fast and secure process for data migration and system updates. It minimizes the risk of errors and downtime, supporting software modernization and data conversion. It also offers monitoring and rollback mechanisms, ensuring compliance and stability in production systems.

item.title: [X] Spring Boot
item.description: Spring Boot is an extension of the Spring Framework that simplifies the creation and deployment of Java applications by automating configuration and supporting the rapid development of web applications, REST services, and microservices. With Spring Boot, the process of creating Spring-based applications becomes more efficient, allowing for quick setup and deployment with minimal configuration.

item.title: [X?] External Secrets
item.description: External Secrets Operator is a tool for Kubernetes environments that enables integration with various external secret management systems. It operates by retrieving data from these external sources using their APIs and automatically injecting this data into Kubernetes Secret resources. Its goal is to facilitate the synchronization and management of secrets between external systems and Kubernetes.

item.title: Harbor
item.description: Harbor operates as a platform enabling the management of container repositories in Kubernetes environments.

item.title: [X] Tekton Operator
item.description: Tekton Operator is a management mechanism within the Kubernetes ecosystem that automates the deployment, scaling, and management of resources associated with the Tekton platform. Download our ready Helm Charts tailored for Tekton-Operator.

item.title: [X] Barman
item.description: Barman is a tool for managing backups and data recovery in PostgreSQL, offering full and incremental backups, WAL archiving, and fast disaster recovery.

item.title: [X] Zaproxy
item.description: ZAProxy is an open-source tool for testing web application security, detecting vulnerabilities like SQL Injection and XSS, with proxy functionality and CI/CD support.

item.title: [X] Shipwright Operator
item.description: Shipwright-Operator is a tool managing the delivery, building, and testing of container images in Kubernetes-based environments.

item.title: Jenkins
item.description: Jenkins is an open-source automation server used for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines, enabling developers to automate building, testing, and deploying software. Download our ready Helm Charts tailored for Jenkins.

item.title: [X] Repmgr
item.description: repmgr operates as a replication manager for PostgreSQL clusters.

item.title: [X] Activiti
item.description: Activiti is a BPM platform for business process automation, compliant with BPMN 2.0. It enables modeling, monitoring, and integration of processes using a graphical editor and API for programmatic control.

item.title: Apache Camel K
item.description: Apache Camel K is a lightweight, Kubernetes-native version of Apache Camel that enables rapid deployment of integrations in cloud-based container environments. It automates application lifecycle processes, making it easier to scale microservices and monitor integrations.

item.title: Trivy
item.description: Trivy is a vulnerability analysis tool for containers. It is a vulnerability scanner that automatically scans container images and reports discovered security vulnerabilities and other potential threats.

item.title: [X] Shipwright-CLI
item.description: Shipwright-CLI is an interactive command-line tool used for managing and automating processes related to building, testing, and deploying container images in Kubernetes-based environments. Download our ready Helm Charts tailored for Shipwright-CLI.

item.title: [X] Kyverno Policy Reporter
item.description: Kyverno Policy Reporter is a tool for monitoring Kubernetes resource compliance with Kyverno policies, supporting data visualization and integration with notification systems like Slack and Elasticsearch.

item.title: Prometheus
item.description: Prometheus is a monitoring and alerting system widely used in cloud and microservices environments. It is an open-source tool that enables the collection of metrics from various components of IT infrastructure, such as servers, containers, databases, etc.

item.title: Sonarqube
item.description: SonarQube operates as a platform for automatic code quality analysis.

item.title: Kyverno
item.description: Kyverno is an open source policy engine for Kubernetes, enabling the definition, management, and enforcement of security and compliance policies within a Kubernetes cluster.

item.title: Istio
item.description: Istio is a platform for managing traffic, securing, and monitoring services in microservices environments.

item.title: [X] Forgejo
item.description: Forgejo operates as a platform for self-hosting software, managing projects, collaborating, and developing software according to one’s own preferences and needs.

item.title: ClickHouse
item.description: ClickHouse is an open-source, columnar database specializing in ultra-fast analytics and real-time processing of large data volumes. Optimized for handling massive datasets, ClickHouse enables lightning-fast execution of complex SQL queries, making it ideal for companies focused on big data and business analytics. It supports cluster processing, allowing efficient querying of distributed data and real-time report generation.

item.title: Gpbackup S3
item.description: GPBackup-S3 is a tool for automatic backups of Greenplum Database with Amazon S3 integration. It enables easy storage, restoration, and verification of full and incremental backups in a secure, scalable cloud. This is an ideal solution for organizations looking to efficiently manage data in the cloud.

item.title: Redis
item.description:
Description

Redis functions as an efficient, non-relational database management system that stores data in a key-value structure within the primary storage of the server, ensuring swift access to information.

item.title: Apache Doris
item.description: Apache Doris is a distributed, open-source OLAP database optimized for high performance and ease of use. With its MPP (Massively Parallel Processing) model, it supports real-time analytical and operational queries, making it ideal for big data applications, recommendation systems, and business dashboards. Apache Doris offers user-friendliness and integration with popular analytics tools, enabling quick deployment and efficient report generation.

item.title: [X] Pgloader
item.description: pgLoader is a data loading tool for PostgreSQL.

item.title: [X] Pgbadger
item.description: pgBadger is a PostgreSQL log analyzer that generates detailed reports based on log files.

item.title: [X] Pglogical
item.description: PgLogical is an extension for PostgreSQL that enables logical data replication between instances, offering selective data replication and support for migrations and synchronization between databases.

item.title: Kibana
item.description: Kibana is an advanced tool for data visualization and analysis, serving as a key component in the Elastic Stack.

item.title: [X] Apache Camel
item.description: Apache Camel is a flexible, open-source integration framework that enables the creation of complex data exchange processes across different systems. Camel excels in microservice integration and business process automation, allowing for easy creation of flexible data flows.

item.title: Apache Camel Karavan
item.description: Apache Camel Karavan is a visual extension of Apache Camel that enables intuitive integration design using Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIP) through a drag-and-drop interface. This makes it easier for DevOps teams and developers to create complex data flows and orchestrate processes, making it ideal for cloud and containerized environments.

item.title: ActiveMQ
item.description: ActiveMQ is an open-source message queuing system that supports protocols such as JMS, STOMP, MQTT, and AMQP. It enables asynchronous message exchange in distributed environments, providing reliability, scalability, and ease of use. Ideal for cloud and microservice applications, ActiveMQ offers high availability and support for clustering and message replication, enabling the creation of event-driven applications and system integration.

item.title: Gitea
item.description: Gitea is a software including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD.

item.title: Starrocks
item.description: StarRocks is a modern MPP (Massively Parallel Processing) database designed for advanced analytics with ultra-fast OLAP queries. It enables simultaneous processing of historical and operational data, making it ideal for applications requiring real-time analytics. StarRocks combines the flexibility of NoSQL with the performance of SQL, supporting various data formats and integrating with popular analytics tools. It ensures high query performance and supports complex analyses.

item.title: Nodejs
item.description: Node.js stands as a dynamic runtime environment, utilizing the V8 engine, specifically crafted for the development of contemporary, interactive web applications.

item.title: Databend
item.description: Databend is an open-source, Rust-based cloud data warehouse offering high performance for large datasets, with features like Time Travel, Multi Catalog, and seamless scalability across various object storage solutions.

item.title: [X] Polardb
item.description: PolarDB is a distributed cloud database from Alibaba Cloud, combining the features of commercial and open-source databases. It supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Oracle. It offers flexible resource scaling, low latency, and high availability. Based on InnoDB technology, PolarDB ensures high performance and full MySQL compatibility.

item.title: [X] Coder
item.description: Coder is a platform that enables remote access to development environments through a web browser.

item.title: [X] Spring Framework
item.description: Spring Framework is a versatile Java framework that supports the development of web applications, REST services, and microservices. It offers tools such as Dependency Injection and AOP, as well as support for enterprise applications, including transaction management, security, and other aspects of application development. With its flexible architecture, Spring simplifies the creation of complex systems, improving their quality and performance.

item.title: RabbitMQ
item.description: RabbitMQ is a sophisticated system for message queuing, serving as a resilient intermediary solution that facilitates seamless communication among different elements within distributed applications.

item.title: CloudNative-PG
item.description: CloudNativePG (CNPG) is an open-source platform designed to seamlessly manage PostgreSQL databases in Kubernetes environments. It covers the entire operational lifecycle—from deployment to ongoing maintenance—through its core component, the CloudNativePG operator.

item.title: Apache Servicemix
item.description: Description
